item.title: donuts for the workplace
item.description: the great combiner, that which brings all people of the office together: donuts. visitors are in town this week (people who usually work off-site but are mandated to visit monthly) so i had the bright idea of buying donuts for them. unfortunately i bought too few donuts, but my concerns went noticed and were allayed by my senior coworker who fixed the problem with one simple trick: buy more donuts.

item.title: the qk65v2
item.description: after months of using the realforce r2 as my daily driver board, i am back to using the qk65 v2 from qwertykeys. i built this keyboard out using Sunny Side Up linear switches from CannonKeys. these switches were chosen because i thought they were a rather neat looking gag of a switch design; i was pleasantly surprised at how nice they sound after lubing and filming. honestly, probably my favorite linear of all time

item.title: internet issues
item.description: ask any person who spends time on their computer: the worst thing ever is internet issues. people don’t like feeling like they’re not in control, unsurprisingly, and so when it comes to catastrophic problems that are basically strictly out of your hands, internet problems take the cake. restart the router? are there a shitload of people using the wifi at your house? are you gonna have to talk to a support line to get this shit fixed?
